ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing bond redemption type transactions.
These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.

desc.p: This is a sub valued language field. Standard T24 numeric field.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 3 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the TRANSACTION file.
Where and if a Nominee code formed part of a Redemption Transaction. At transaction level the system would default or assume the Nominee Code ID entered here.
As the nominee code is part of the stored security position great care should be used when setting up standard defaults to ensure no problems at Transaction level.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type S) standard nominee code. Optional input.
Must exist as a valid Nominee Code.

Redemptions are by nature security debit type transactions. Here we are setting up a transaction code for that security debit; this code will then be linked within. SC.Trans. type to Form A unique Dr. + and Cr. for all Redemption Type Transactions.
Cancellations will automatically assume the CR Type Transaction code.
1-3 Alpha numeric characters, (Type S). Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Security Transaction. Name (SC.TRANS.NAME)
This is a sub valued language field. Standard T24 numeric field.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 3 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the TRANSACTION file.
Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application.

9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country Code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.
This field is used to specify the debit transaction code which will be used for reallowance transactions within the REDEMPTION.CUS application.
Must be a valid record on the TRANSACTION file.
Mandatory Input.
Standard Commission rate to be applied to Customers for Redemption type transactions

Standard Commission rates are normally published by a Banks' Portfolio Managers and where a commission is indicated for Bond Redemptions that rate can be stored once and for all. '0.00' is allowed to cater for no change on Redemption Type Transactions.
0-5 characters Standard Rate format. Mandatory input.

If bonds are to be withdrawn from our safe custody account either via a physical depository (our own Securities Vault) or a Global Depository such as Euroclear in our books the Dr. transaction to the client must have a matching credit to a valid depository Account.
For early redemptions where we advise the customer of an impending withdrawal we will likewise effectively do the same for the depository.
1-3 Alpha numeric characters (Type S). Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Security Transaction name (SC.TRANS.NAME).
Specifies the category code to be used for the posting of exchange Profit & Loss entries.

This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's position.
4 or 5 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.
Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999.
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
Used when the automatic bond redemption facility is requested - as it dictates the type of advice run to be processed. In this instance whether it's a pre advice type or not.
A pre advice type transaction will remove stock from base security and place it on an identical security no. but with a suffix '-234'. This is the acknowledged early redemption indicator.

Note: This type is used for the Automatic Redemption request where the System indicates that the type of Redemption should be a Final type. System cannot possibly identify early or partial draw downs - therefore it can only create a pre advised Final Redemption.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters (Type S). Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Redemption Type.
Specifies "Own Account Trading/Investment" portfolio.
Y or blank
Stores the Category Code for the Depository Charge (Foreign Charge) applicable on a Redemption Transaction.

Maximum Charge Indicator. The system will utilise Field 13 for calculating commission but where it exceeds Field 14 the amount is Field 14 i.e. the maximum charge will be displayed.

Suspense Account for depository posting to be used while processing Redemption transactions.
Effectively a suspense or wash account for all Redemption Nostro entries. Until all entries for on Bond Redemption are authorised the Depository entry will not be posted to the nostro concerned.
4-10 type 'AAA'(uppercase or lowercase alpha) characters. Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Account Class.

Must exist as a valid Transaction Change Code.

It is anticipated that where the User advises Clients' of an early redemption by means of a PRE-ADVICE the Stock concerned will be attributed a different suffix number. T24 will recognise -234 as an early Redemption Type Security which cannot therefore be re-sold. Addition to a valid security number of '-234'.
To prevent a Client or Account Officer Reselling stock which has been effectively 'Drawn' a separate Security position will be created for the 'Drawn stock'.
Note: For all early redemptions a user will first have to open a new Security (the copy function can be used) and it can be titled "Early Redemption".
Two positions will be shown on a Client's valuation - although no financial entries will be passed until the Bonds are actually redeemed.
Mandatory input.
Defines the standard delivery instructions to be used with a redemption type transaction i.e. delivery of stock out free or against payment.

For a redemption the normal type of delivery instruction would be of a type delivery against payment. The delivery instructions impact for example on the SEC. DEL. Control section of portfolio management i.e. is stock to be physically received and/or against a financial consideration.
1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type S). Mandatory input.
Must exist as a valid Security Delivery Instruction (SC DEL INSTR) code.
A maximum of 16 characters may be entered.
